meanings.definition: To place or fix in position for use or service.
meanings.sent1: Dad installed the new light fixture in the living room.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed the software on my computer.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel installed itself comfortably on the tree branch.
meanings.sent4: The idea of kindness was installed in her heart from a young age.
meanings.sent5: The new playground equipment was installed with great care and precision.

meanings.definition: To establish in an office, position, or place.
meanings.sent1: The company installed a new manager to oversee the project.
meanings.sent2: She was installed as the president of the organization.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully installed itself on the warm spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: His words of wisdom were installed in the minds of his students.
meanings.sent5: The painting was installed in the art gallery for all to admire.

meanings.definition: To set up for use or service.
meanings.sent1: We installed the tent for our camping trip.
meanings.sent2: The plumber installed a new water heater in the basement.
meanings.sent3: The clown installed a big red nose on his face.
meanings.sent4: She installed a sense of adventure in her children.
meanings.sent5: The new security system was installed to protect the building.
